bibl.title: P. Artemid.: A Papyrologist's View.
bibl.note: P. Artemid. (= M.-P.3 168.02; LDAB 7132). - Cartonnage. - Text: script and mise en page. - Contexts of reuse. - "(i) To my eye the papyrus itself, and its script, look perfectly plausible; so does the detailed description of Spain. My doubts focus on the "proem"; - (ii) The editio princeps presents a high cultural and hierarchical view of the papyrus (édition de luxe). I hazard a deliberately contrary view: the text is the casual product of a provincial trainee."

bibl.title: Images and Texts on the "Artemidorus Papyrus". Working Papers on P. Artemid. (St. John's College Oxford, 2008)

bibl.seg: PARSONS Peter, P. Artemid.: A Papyrologist's View.

Kai BRODERSEN and Jaś ELSNER (Edd.), Images and Texts on the "Artemidorus Papyrus". Working Papers on P. Artemid. (St. John's College Oxford, 2008) = Historia. Einzelschriften. 214 (Stuttgart, 2009) pp. 27-33.

P. Artemid. (= M.-P.3 168.02; LDAB 7132). - Cartonnage. - Text: script and mise en page. - Contexts of reuse. - "(i) To my eye the papyrus itself, and its script, look perfectly plausible; so does the detailed description of Spain. My doubts focus on the "proem"; - (ii) The editio princeps presents a high cultural and hierarchical view of the papyrus (édition de luxe). I hazard a deliberately contrary view: the text is the casual product of a provincial trainee."
